glsa.title: TPTEST: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities in TPTEST may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

background.p: TPTEST is a tool to measure the speed of a userâ€™s Internet connection.

description.p: The GetStatsFromLine() function in TPTEST is vulnerable to buffer overflows from STATS lines with long email and pwd fields.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted STATS line, possibly resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All TPTEST users should upgrade to the latest version:
